Title: Trump Urges Ukraine to Drop NATO Bid and Crimea Claims
Article Text: Trump’s suggestion that Ukraine abandon hopes for Crimea and NATO echoes the historical precedent of great power politics shaping Eastern Europe’s fate—like the Yalta Conference in 1945, where leaders redrew boundaries without smaller nations’ direct input. Such pressure could fracture Western unity, undermine Ukraine’s sovereignty, and encourage further Russian territorial ambitions, as appeasement has historically emboldened aggressors. The potential fallout includes weakened alliances and diminished trust in U.S. commitments to international security.
